alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:37PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chester County through 830 PM EDT... At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Terre Hill to near Gap to near Rock Springs. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coatesville, Downingtown, Kennett Square, Oxford, Parkesburg, West Grove, Honey Brook, Elverson, Homeville, Glen Roy, Cochranville, Pughtown, Mount Vernon, Marshallton, Glenmoore, Landenberg, Kemblesville, Lionville, Lionville-Marchwood and North Star. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 300 and 313. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
